page.title: 20Government.
page.content: The town was granted it's town status by a charter from Queen Elizabeth 1 and has had a Mayor ever since.The present Mayor is Mr.Eric Dunlop. The town used to belong to Basingstoke Parliamentary Constituency but under the boundary changes made before the General Election of 1983 the town has now switched to the North Hampshire Constituency and the present Member of Parliament with responsibility for this area is Mr,David Mitchell. We who have taken part in the survey that Whitchurch will never change dramatically,and that it will always continue to be a very pleasant country town both in which to work and live.
